website_summaries.verdict: Despite its less-than-perfect text quality, we consider this to be one of the best all-around deals for an affordable color laser.
cons: control panel and design are confusing

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Noisy, Expensive Consumables
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a steal at the price. The color copies are great. It's way too loud, though--loud enough to be very distracting in a modest-sized room. I've replaced the four cartridges once so far--it's delivered with undersized ones. They are surprisingly pricey--the total for the four comes close to the cost of the printer. Notwithstanding all of that, it works well (double-sided copies, even) and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Puglis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer, cheap to operate
customer_reviews.text: When I chose this printer, it was a new model, so it has been a few years. I needed a good reliable color printer for my ex and our kids. At the time it was the cheapest per page to operate, and that was with factory toner cartridges. You can buy refilled, or save even more and refill them yourself! It prints very well, and I have not had any problems with it. In fact, I bought a second one for me I like it so much! Even though it is an older model now it is almost the end of 2013, I would still recommend it over any of the current models available.
customer_reviews.author: Electron -

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy things from this supplier
customer_reviews.text: The printer was supposed to be refurbished, and it just didn't work. I had to write 4 emails and wait about a month before I got a response and my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Mendivil

customer_reviews.title: Shipped in Brocken and massed up with loose toner In ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipped in Brocken and massed up with loose toner In and out side of machine took 2 hours to cleanup by two person Printing faire
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the above from Best Buy ten years ago. I have gone thru 5 high capacity black cartridges. The machine is still going. The color cartridges work just as well although I don't use them that much. The only way to go with the cartridges is to buy the re-manufactured ones but not from Samsung as they are too expensive. The duplex feature is a welcome addition and I hardly get any misfeeds. There is an outlet for the heavier wt papers.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C Placerncia

customer_reviews.title: a little fuzzy
customer_reviews.text: Despite the high resolution numbers claimed this machine is a bit fuzzier for B&W printing than my 7-year-old HP laserprinter. On the plus side, the printer was easy to set up for Windows XP printing through a network-attached storage disk array. The pages are smear-proof unlike those from an inkjet printer. I don't think that there is any other printer at this price that will duplex (print on both sides). Make sure that you have a friend named Bruno when it is time to hoist this puppy into the car or onto a desk.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Greenspun

customer_reviews.title: prints duplex but has several problems...
customer_reviews.text: have this printer for 6 months now. the best feature is duplex-printing, which works very well. as most reviewers have pointed out, the text/graphics outputs are not very sharp, but can be easily pardoned for the price. however, there are two other major problems. (1) limited color range. e.g., deep red gets printed as orange. (2) cannot print fine lines -- if you try to print line-art, then expect the lines to be thickened. if you have alternating black and white lines of equal width, the printout will show black over-powering white significantly. i am getting another hp 2600n, but will keep the 510n around for draft work and volume duplex printing.
customer_reviews.author: Frog G

customer_reviews.title: Just plain junk - bargain printer - sub-par support
customer_reviews.text: Bought it new 3 months ago, it wrapped paper around one of the rollers, (an internal roller you cannot access), Samsung has put me around and around in circles for 2 weeks over a warranty repair. So, into the junk pile it goes - let the buyer beware, you get what you pay for! And the thing is, they don't even care if people never buy their products again. Too bad they couldn't just stand behind their warranty.....
customer_reviews.author: Keven L. Mehaffy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: After comparing several of the "budget" color laser printers, I settled on this one for 2 reasons: the price (under $300 after mail in rebate) and because the toner cartridges are separate and do not have HP's "not-so-smart" technology. What I have found after using this for a month is that the starter toner cartridges have lasted-- I just changed the yellow after atleast 2000 color pages being printed (mostly greens), and the other cartridges are still going strong. I have not had any problems with this printer, just make sure that you select the proper type of paper that you are printing on. I would definitely recommend this color laser printers to others.
customer_reviews.author: Dana H. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: A comment from one of the readers indicated that there is "bad burning smell almost like plastic". I purchased from Staples and have the same problem and plan to return it. Suspected reason: The roller at the top does not stop rotating when the printer goes into SLEEP mode. The top area appears to be very hot as well. I am sure it is going to catch fire on a warm sunny day. -- Follow up Comment- Samsung promptly replaced the defect roller -- and it is working very well for me. I can give it a 4 star now.
customer_reviews.author: V. Kanabar

customer_reviews.title: NO PHOTO PAPER ACCEPTED
customer_reviews.text: Argghhh, thought I could get rid of my inkjet. Wrong. CLP 510 will not print on glossy photo paper. First, I was going to call the repairman, but then wandered to the Samsung site and in horribly poor translated English was informed that this particular printer will only print on regular paper. But what the hey. Awsome for everyday use with wonderful colors and good enough for hubby's MBA epitomes.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaInMD

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to print color documents made in Word, Excel, and Publisher, or PDFs. When I couldn't print any color documents, I called Samsung's tech support. Following tech support's directions, I could print only a Word file in black and white. After unsuccessful attempts to print color documents, tech support said the color printer lacks "postscript drivers" that is needed to print color documents made in Word, Excel, Publisher, or PDFs. Something is missing here? I don't know how others are able to print color documents, but I returned it since the color printer wasn't able to print color.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Woo

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with printer
customer_reviews.text: I have used this printer for many jobs since purchasing it. It has performed well and is faster than my previous one. It warms up quickly and although a little noisy is less so that an older printer. The colors are excellent and the type is crisp and clear. I have used it for preparing training materials and it performs very well with both text and diagrams. I am delighted with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: R. Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: Latch
customer_reviews.text: The latch on top the printer will only release one side! You have to jiggle the top, push and pull but it will come open. To fix this, tie a string around release lever and leave the string hanging out. The next time the top will not open, push the button and pull on the string. I know...... what a jury rig!! but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible printer. I have had nothing but trouble with it since the install(which was easy. The print quality is marginal, the paper jams every day! I have tried 6 different paper types all the same result. The toner over spray or what ever the canister is under the front panel that is supposed to catch it leaks. The thing is noisy and poor quality. SATAY AWAY! I have an HP 4700 that is expensive but amazing, a Lexmark(noisy but great) and slew of B&W various models. NO other unit has caused so much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Rating Samsung CLP-510
customer_reviews.text: This is our main office color copy and overall it does an adequate job. Printer was easy to install and setup. Color is good. Paper needs to be fanned carefully to avoid paper jams and even then we still have some. Paper tray cannot be fully loaded or it jams easily. We have adjusted how we use this printer and it is functioning fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Backscheider

customer_reviews.title: Improvement?????
customer_reviews.text: This is our second CLP product. Our first was the CLP-500. The 510 seems to be louder than the 500 but does produce the same nice output. We ordered a 510 because it uses the same supplies as the 500. The cost per page seems to be fairly high because of the disposables but the printer seems to be quite reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V. Blyzka

customer_reviews.title: Stay away, you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since buying this printer I've only had it operational about half of the time within the first six months. I've spend about $50 on parts it told me I needed only to find out it was a bad sensor. Eventually Samsung send a tech out to fix it. Even that was about a month after they said it would be. Thankfully, I kept my old inkjet as a backup. I will not but any Samsung products in the future. Keith
customer_reviews.author: Keith J. Mclendon

customer_reviews.title: Samsung CLP-510 Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible printer. I cannot imagine owning any other comparable type of unit. Like my earlier Samsung B/W laser printer, this color unit is an incredible piece of technology. Yes, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Robert Perring

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.text: After I receipt the printer, set up and turn on. I bought the defective repubish unit. I didn't want to sent 80 pound to post office and spent extra $90 on it for repair. what can i do? I learn that I will never buy on line again unless seller shall paid fee for their poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. H. Enterprise

product_meta.title: Samsung CLP-510 Color Laser Printer
feature_bullets: Up to 6 ppm Color Print Speed and 25 ppm Black
Built-in Auto Duplexing and Up to 1200 dpi Effective Output
Innovative NO NOIS Static Engine for Unparalleled Reliability
